documents.content: Vivacity Health processed claim #VH2023-41892 for Konnor Zielinski (PATIENT_ID: VH-ZK418), involving a complex spinal fusion procedure at Lakeshore Surgical Center. The procedure was necessitated by progressive cauda equina syndrome, with pre-authorization granted on 08/15/2023. Documentation includes neurosurgeon Dr. Elise Woodward's operative notes and post-op care plan through 10/01/2023. Out-of-network coverage was approved under exception policy VP403-2H.

Lakeshore Surgical Center's quality assurance committee reviewed case VS-8294 involving Konnor Zielinski (DOB 06/04/1987). The 9-hour procedure on 09/12/2023 utilized experimental biocompatible stabilizers (study ID: SPI-09X). Post-operative complications included CSF leakage, managed with blood patching. Patient discharged to Horizonview Rehab on 09/22 under supervising physician Dr. A. Mirani (ext. 73230).

Vivacity Health memo dated 11/10/2023 alerts providers about VP403-2H exception policy revisions. Effective 01/2024, reimbursement for experimental spinal stabilization devices requires IRB approval documentation. This impacts 47 ongoing claims including #VH2023-41892. Network adequacy analysis shows only 21% of haulage industry workers have accessible in-network spine care within 100 miles of Hebron, ND.

The Industrial Medicine Journal published retrospective analysis of 412 haulage workers with cauda equina syndrome. Study SPI-09X showed 38% shorter recovery times when combining traditional fusion with experimental retrofit stabilizers. Lead researcher Dr. Woodward will present findings at the 12/05 Tulsa Spine Symposium. Case examples include a 36-year-old male (VAKU97722) with post-op CSF complication resolved at 42 days.

metadata.content_summary: Complex spinal fusion case involving experimental technology, policy exceptions, and haulage industry health trends

questions.q: What experimental treatment and post-operative complication were documented for Konnor Zielinski's procedure under study SPI-09X?
questions.a: Experimental biocompatible stabilizers were used, with post-op CSF leakage as complication.

questions.q: What industry demographic showed limited spinal care network adequacy near Hebron, ND?
questions.a: Only 21% of haulage industry workers have accessible in-network spine care.

questions.q: Which two providers were involved in Konnor Zielinski's spinal fusion and subsequent rehabilitation?
questions.a: Dr. Elise Woodward performed surgery and Dr. A. Mirani supervised rehab.

questions.q: What policy change and clinical study impact claims involving experimental spine devices?
questions.a: VP403-2H policy now requires IRB approval, affecting study SPI-09X claims.
